intro: Glochidion barronense, commonly known as the Barron River holly, is a small evergreen shrub native to the rainforests of Queensland, Australia. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves that are often covered in fine, white pubescence. The plant produces small yellowish-green flowers followed by woody, capsule-like fruits containing numerous seeds. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in the understorey of tropical rainforests. Due to its restricted distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and vulnerable species.
